techmeme.title: Bluesky now requires parody or fan accounts to label themselves as such after a researcher found 44% of its 100 most-followed accounts have a doppelganger (Mariella Moon/Engadget)
OpenAI says it plans to build data centers in parts of the US Midwest and Southwest; sources: OpenAI is spending $5B+ a year and is "not close to breaking even" (Financial Times)
Salesforce says online Black Friday sales hit $74.4B globally, up 5% YoY, and $17.5B in the US, up 7% YoY; Adobe says US online sales hit $10.8B, up 10.2% YoY (Ingrid Lunden/TechCrunch)
Ex-Meta crypto chief David Marcus says there was no legal or regulatory angle for the government to kill its Libra project and "it was 100% a political kill" (David Marcus/@davidmarcus)
Google, which joined the Open Cloud Coalition, denies its offer of €100M+ in incentives to CISPE was linked to CISPE's antitrust complaint against Microsoft (Paul Kunert/The Register)
